Posts.Content:
I am so sorry to hear this. I remember Shelley, and how much she wanted a baby. This is heartbreaking. How many, many beautiful friends we have lost to this hateful disease. It is maddening!
Hugs, Pam
Posts.Title: Sad News!

Posts.Content:
Hi Simone,
I also am from CO. Was in your shoes almost 5 years ago. Dr and surgeon both told me they were 95% sure it was nothing. My tumor was hard, like a pea, didn't move and didn't hurt. Also didn't show up on the mammo or ultrasound. Keep pushing, the only way to find out for sure is biopsy, if it is benign, Great! Don't let them make you feel this is unimportant.
Hugs, Pam
Posts.Title: Found lump in breast

Posts.Content:
No problem MK, I have been AWOL for awhile. Hope all is well, it will take me a bit to catch up. 
Hugs back to you, Pam
BTW Simone, here is my email, hope this won't be deleted because I can give you the name of my onc who is incredible. He spent 2 hours explaining details to my husband and I the first time we saw him. leafmtn@frii.com
Posts.Title: Found lump in breast

Posts.Content:
Simone,
You probably need to make an appt with a surgeon first, the oncologist won't need to see you unless you are dx'd with cancer. Hopefully the onc won't be needed but if you do I have a great one at Rose Medical, at the Rocky Mtn Cancer Center. We have terrific docs here.
Hugs, Pam
Posts.Title: Denver, CO Kaiser Permanente - Oncologist?

Posts.Content:
Cathi,
Hugs and love from Colorado. I haven't checked in for awhile, but dropped by and saw your post. My heart goes out to you. You are a dear, strong lady, and have given so much to us all. I am getting ready to present a testimony of the past 5 years of my life, and feel so overwhelmed by it all. How life changed for us all, right? The one thing that is constant is the love and sisterhood we all share.
Hugs, Pam
Posts.Title: My 6 year anniversary was on February 14th...but.....

Posts.Content:
I am Pam, 46, from Colorado. Another ivillage refugee, 3 years ago I found support and great information from many of you. Not knowing any other bc survivors, my sisters of the heart there were lifesavers to me. I was dx'd with tubular carcinoma, but 7 surgeries and 3 years later life is good again...different, but good. Great to see so many familiar names here.
Hugs, Pam
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share
